sound

Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • sound.Sound

  • public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains useful methods for sound capture and playback. These methods use the new javax.sound.sampled API. All these methods can (currently) only play files with the .wav, .aiff, or the .au file formats.
    Author:
    Shardul

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • preloadedPlay

        public static void preloadedPlay(java.lang.String filePath)
        Loads and plays a specified .wav, .au, or .aiff audio file in the background. This method first loads the complete file into memory, and then plays it in a separate Thread. This method is not recommended for long files and is not guaranteed to work with files which do not follow the .wav, .aiff, or .au file formats. For long files, refer to the 'See Also' section.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A String specifying the audio file to be played.
        See Also:
        bufferedPlay(java.lang.String), preloadedLoop(java.lang.String), preloadedLoop(java.lang.String, int)

      • preloadedLoop

        public static void preloadedLoop(java.lang.String filePath,
                 int points)
        Loops a .wav, .au, or .aiff audio file for the specified number of times by repeatedly loading and playing it. This method makes use of preloadedPlay(java.lang.String). This method is not recommended for long files. This method is not guaranteed to work with files which do not follow the .wav, .aiff, or .au file formats.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A String specifying the audio file to be played.
        points - The number of times to loop the file. If 0, loops continuously.
        See Also:
        preloadedPlay(java.lang.String), bufferedLoop(java.lang.String), bufferedLoop(java.lang.String, int), preloadedLoop(java.lang.String)

      • preloadedLoop

        public static void preloadedLoop(java.lang.String filePath)
        Loops a .wav, .au, or .aiff audio file forever by repeatedly loading and playing it.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A String specifying the audio file to be played.
        See Also:
        preloadedPlay(java.lang.String), preloadedLoop(java.lang.String, int), bufferedLoop(java.lang.String), bufferedLoop(java.lang.String, int)

      • bufferedPlay

        public static void bufferedPlay(java.lang.String filePath)
        Buffers and plays a specified .wav, .au, or .aiff audio file. This method continuously streams and, at the same time, plays audio from the specified file until the audio is over. This method is useful when the duration of the file is unknown, the audio is being streamed live, or the file is long. This method is not guaranteed to work with files which do not follow the .wav, .aiff, or .au file formats.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A String specifying the audio file to be played.
        See Also:
        preloadedPlay(java.lang.String), bufferedLoop(java.lang.String), bufferedLoop(java.lang.String, int)

      • bufferedLoop

        public static void bufferedLoop(java.lang.String filePath,
                int points)
        Loops a .wav, .au, or .aiff audio file for the specified number of times by repeatedly buffering and playing it. This method makes use of bufferedPlay(java.lang.String). This method is not guaranteed to work with files which do not follow the .wav, .aiff, or .au file formats.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A String specifying the audio file to be played.
        points - The number of times to loop the file. If 0, loops continuously.
        See Also:
        bufferedPlay(java.lang.String), bufferedLoop(java.lang.String, int), preloadedLoop(java.lang.String), preloadedLoop(java.lang.String, int)

      • bufferedLoop

        public static void bufferedLoop(java.lang.String filePath)
        Loops a .wav, .au, or .aiff audio file forever by repeatedly buffering and playing it.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A String specifying the audio file to be played.
        See Also:
        bufferedPlay(java.lang.String), bufferedLoop(java.lang.String, int), preloadedLoop(java.lang.String, int), preloadedLoop(java.lang.String)

      • beep

        public static void beep()
        Emits the system default audio beep.
